Movement with cambered bar as shown above is also known as EZ Barbell Curl or EZ Bar Curl. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.

Barbell.name: Drag Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise barbell straight up so elbows travel back as elbows flex. follow contour of hips and waist. as elbows continues to flex, begin bringing elbows forward when forearms rises past horizontal position. continue upward over chest until forearms are perpendicular. lower until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Bringing elbows back forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical, permits a relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Exercise can also be performed with EZ barbell, in which case, making it also known as EZ Barbell or EZ Bar Drag Curl. Also see standard Barbell Curl. Also see side view.

Cable.name: Alternating Curl

instructions.preparation: stand between or facing double low pulleys. grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
instructions.execution: pull one stirrup up forward and upward toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. return until arm is fully extended. repeat on other arm, alternating between sides.

Cable.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.

Cable.name: Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. stand close to pulley.
instructions.execution: with elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. lower until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Dumbbell.name: Incline Curl

instructions.preparation: sit back on 45-60 degree incline bench. with arms hanging down straight, position two dumbbells with palms facing inward.
instructions.execution: with elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. continue to alternate between sides.

Dumbbell.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see mechanical analysis of arm curl and question regarding elbow position.

Lever (selectorized).name: Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp handles with underhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise lever handles until elbows are fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. lower handles until arm is fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating or simultaneous. If machine does not provide support for back of arm, keep elbows from traveling back, particularly during initial flexion. Some machines do not offer adequate resistance at initial range of motion. Consider positioning wrists with slight flexion to compensate.

Body Weight.name: Chin-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbows are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Body Weight.comments: Easier

Barbell.name: Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise bar until forearms are vertical. lower barbell until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. Also known as Scott Curl.

Barbell.name: Prone Incline Curl

instructions.preparation: lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. from low rack or partner, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise bar until arms are flexed. lower barbell until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Barbell.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. Also known as Barbell Spider Curl.

Cable.name: Concentration Curl

instructions.preparation: facing low pulley cable, sit on seat or bench with legs apart to each side. grasp stirrup attachment. place upper arm against inner thigh.
instructions.execution: pull stirrup to front of shoulder until elbow is completely flexed. lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

Cable.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

Cable.name: Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise cable bar toward shoulders. lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack. Also see movement on horizontal pad.

Cable.name: Prone Incline Curl

instructions.preparation: lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. grasp  cable attachment with shoulder width underhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise bar until arms are flexed. lower barbell until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: Also known as Cable Spider Curl. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. Also known as Cable Spider Curl.

Dumbbell.name: Concentration Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on bench. grasp dumbbell between feet. place back of upper arm to inner thigh. lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.
instructions.execution: raise dumbbell to front of shoulder. lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

Dumbbell.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

Dumbbell.name: Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp dumbbell and sit on preacher bench. with arm bent and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm down on pad.
instructions.execution: lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

Dumbbell.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.

Dumbbell.name: Prone Incline Curl

instructions.preparation: lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. from elevated platform or partner, grasp dumbbell and position palms forward.
instructions.execution: raise dumbbells until arms are flexed. lower dumbbells until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Alternatively, knees can also be placed on seat.Â The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.Â Also known as Dumbbell Spider Curl.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. grasp lever handles with underhand grip. align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
instructions.execution: raise lever handles toward shoulders. lower handles until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. If no resistance is experienced during initial range of motion, make sure seat is adjusted to allow for back of arm to be positioned flush against arm pad. If resistance is still not experienced, consider keeping wrists in a slight flexed position to compensate. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. Long head of Triceps Brachii is only significant activated as antagonist stabilizer when it approaches passive insufficiency as elbow nears full flexion.

Lever (selectorized).name: Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. grasp lever handles with underhand grip. align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
instructions.execution: raise lever handles toward shoulders. lower handles until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. Long head of Triceps Brachii is only significant activated as antagonist stabilizer when it approaches passive insufficiency as elbow nears full flexion. Also see movements performed on machine with no seat and arms positioned higher.

Suspended.name: Arm Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. while keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body is reclined back. position palms up or slightly inward.
instructions.execution: bring handles toward shoulders by flexing arms, while keeping elbows pointed forward. return by straightening arms and repeat.

Suspended.comments: Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. Also known as Suspended Biceps Curl, arguably somewhat of a misnomer. The positioning of arms, with elbows high, places short head (medial head) of Bicep Brachii in active insufficiency as arm continues to flex. The long head of Biceps Brachii (lateral head) and in particular, Brachialis are primary movers in this position.

Barbell.name: Reverse Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: with elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. lower until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Barbell.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Barbell.name: Reverse Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. grasp curl bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: raise bar until forearms are vertical. lower barbell until arm is fully extended. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

Cable.name: Hammer Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp cable rope with palms facing inward. stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
instructions.execution: with elbows to side, raise rope forward and upward with both arms until forearms are vertical. lower until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Cable.name: Reverse Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
instructions.execution: with elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. lower until arms are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward, slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Dumbbell.name: Hammer Curl

instructions.preparation: position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
instructions.execution: with elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell until forearm is vertical and thumb faces shoulder. lower to original position and repeat with alternative arm.

Dumbbell.comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

Lever (selectorized).name: Hammer Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. grasp lever handles and position grips with thumb side up. align elbows at near same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
instructions.execution: raise lever handles toward shoulders, maintaining palms in grip. lower handles until arm is fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. If machine has secondary lever, elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum.

Lever (selectorized).name: Reverse Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp handles with overhand grip. position elbows to sides so they are in line with lever's fulcrum.
instructions.execution: raise lever handles until elbows are fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. lower handles until arm is fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating or simultaneous. If machine does not provide support for back of arm, keep elbows from traveling back, particularly during initial flexion.

Lever (selectorized).name: Reverse Preacher Curl

instructions.preparation: sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. grasp lever handles with overhand grip. align elbows at near same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
instructions.execution: raise lever handles toward shoulders. lower handles until arm is fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. If machine has secondary lever, elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum.

Stretch.name: Standing

instructions.preparation: cross wrists, point thumbs downward, and clasp hands.
instructions.execution: straighten arms and externally rotate shoulders by back. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Wrist Extensors can also be stretched in this position by flexing forward wrist so hands bend toward side of forward arm. The arm can be crossed to stretch opposite wrist.

Barbell.name: Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: sit and grasp bar with narrow to shoulder width underhand grip. rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
instructions.execution: allow barbell to roll out of palms down to fingers. raise barbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Barbell.comments: Keep elbows approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion.

Cable.name: Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: sit and grasp cable bar with narrow to shoulder width underhand grip. rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
instructions.execution: allow cable bar to roll out of palms down to fingers. raise cable bar back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Cable.comments: None.

Cable.name: Wrist Roller

instructions.preparation: stand behind weight plate(s) on floor and grasp wrist roller handle with both hands; over hand grip.
instructions.execution: with left hand gripping handle, relax grip of right hand and slide grip behind handle (by hypexending wrist) and regrip. relax grip of left hand and flex right wrist. repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. lower weight steadily with opposite movement.

Cable.comments: None.

Dumbbell.name: Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: sit and grasp dumbbell with underhand grip. rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: allow dumbbell to roll out of palm down to fingers. raise dumbbell back up by gripping and pointing knuckles up as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

Dumbbell.name: Ulnar Deviation

instructions.preparation: grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on pinkie side. position arm down to side.
instructions.execution: bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. lower until weighted side is pointing downward. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Grip

instructions.preparation: sit on seat, straddling apparatus. grasp lever handles on each side; fingers around lever handles and base of thumbs around stationary bars.
instructions.execution: squeeze bars together with both hands until lower lever makes contact with upper bars. lower to original position and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Also see muscles for finger articulations and thumb articulations.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with underhand grip. place forearm on padded platform.
instructions.execution: raise bar up until wrist is fully flexed. lower and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Some units, as one illustrated above, may be placed on sturdy table top or on floor. Keep forearm flat on padded platform throughout exercise.

Lever (selectorized).name: Grip

instructions.preparation: sit on seat. grasp lever handles on each side; fingers around lever handles and base of thumbs around stationary bars.
instructions.execution: squeeze bars together with both hands until lever makes contact with stationary bars. lower to original position and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Also see muscles for finger articulations and thumb articulations. See lever grip up close.

Lever (selectorized).name: Ulnar Deviation

instructions.preparation: rotate handle over and under so handle is in slightly downward position toward thighs. grasp handle with thumb ups grip so fist is pulled up under resistance.
instructions.execution: bend wrist so pinky side of fist is pulled down. return to starting position and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: None.

Lever (selectorized).name: Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with underhand grip to each side. place forearms on arm pads.
instructions.execution: raise handles up until wrist is fully flexed. lower handles until wrists are full hyperextended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Keep forearms horizontal, flat on arm pads throughout exercise. See wrist curl up close.

Lever (selectorized).name: Wrist Roller

instructions.preparation: grasp wrist roller handles with both hands; over hand grip.
instructions.execution: with left hand gripping handle, relax grip of right hand and slide grip behind handle (by hypexending wrist) and regrip. relax grip of left hand and flex right wrist. repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. lower weight steadily with opposite movement or loosen grip slightly to control descent of weight stack. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Also see Lever Roller Wrist Extension.

Sled (selectorized).name: One Hand Grip

instructions.preparation: stand in front of apparatus. grasp bar grips with one hand; fingers around far bar and base of thumb around near stationary bar.
instructions.execution: squeeze bar grips together until far bar makes contact with nearest bar. release to original position and repeat.

Sled (selectorized).comments: See sled grip up close. Also see muscles for finger articulations and thumb articulations.

Sled (plate loaded).name: Grip (plate loaded)

instructions.preparation: bend over and grasp bar grips with both hands; fingers under lower bar and base of thumbs over top stationary bar.
instructions.execution: squeeze bar grips together until lower bar makes contact with upper bar. release to original position and repeat.

Sled (plate loaded).comments: Also see muscles for finger articulations  and thumb articulations.

Sled (plate loaded).name: One Hand

instructions.preparation: bend over and grasp bar grips with one hand; fingers under lower bar and base of thumb over top stationary bar.
instructions.execution: squeeze bar grips together until lower bar makes contact with upper bar. release to original position and repeat.

Sled (plate loaded).comments: See exercise on alternative machine. Also see muscles for finger articulations and thumb articulations.

Sled (plate loaded).name: One Hand Pinch Grip

instructions.preparation: place hand around horizontal surfaces; fingers along lower surface and thumb on upper surface.
instructions.execution: pinch surfaces together until lower part makes contact with upper part. release to original position or just before surfaces become too far apart. repeat.

Sled (plate loaded).comments: Also see muscles for finger articulations and thumb articulations.

Stretch.name: Praying

instructions.preparation: place palms together in front of body. point fingers toward neck.
instructions.execution: pushing hands together, lower away from body until wrists separate. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

Stretch.comments: None

Stretch.name: Seated

instructions.preparation: sit on floor. place palms on floor to sides, behind hips with fingers pointing to back.
instructions.execution: lean back with arms straight. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Keep arms straight.

Stretch.name: Single Arm

instructions.preparation: with palm facing downward, grasp underside of fingers with other hand and straighten elbow.
instructions.execution: pull finger and wrist upward and back toward forearm. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

Stretch.comments: None

Stretch.name: Kneeling

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat. place palms of hand on floor with fingers pointing toward knees.
instructions.execution: shift body back with elbows straight. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Keep elbows straight.

Barbell.name: Reverse Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: sit and grasp bar with narrow to shoulder width overhand grip. rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
instructions.execution: raise barbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Keep elbows approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion.

Cable.name: Reverse Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: sit and grasp cable bar with narrow to shoulder width overhand grip. rest forearms on thighs with wrists just beyond knees.
instructions.execution: raise stirrup by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. repeat.

Cable.comments: Do not allow elbows to rise.

Cable.name: Wrist Roller

instructions.preparation: stand behind weight plate(s) on floor and grasp wrist roller handle with both hands; over hand grip.
instructions.execution: with left hand gripping handle, relax grip of right hand and slide grip in front of handle (by flexing wrist) and regrip. relax grip of left hand and hyperextend right wrist. repeat sequence with opposite hands, alternating back and forth until weight plate has raised up near hands. lower weight steadily with opposite movement.

Cable.comments: None.

Dumbbell.name: Radial Deviation

instructions.preparation: grasp half loaded dumbbell with plate on thumb side. position arm down to side.
instructions.execution: bend wrist so weighted side is pulled upward. lower until weighted side is pointing downward. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: If half loaded dumbbell is not available, one of two substitutes can be used.

Dumbbell.name: Reverse Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: sit and grip dumbbell with overhand grip. rest forearm on thigh with wrist just beyond knee.
instructions.execution: raise dummbell by pointing knuckles upward as high as possible. return until knuckles are pointing downward as far as possible. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Keep elbow approximately wrist height to maintain resistance through full range of motion. Hand may be placed under wrist to offer stability and to maintain horizontal orientation of forearm.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Reverse Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with overhand grip. place forearm on padded platform.
instructions.execution: raise bar until wrist is fully hyperextended and return until wrist is fully flexed. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Some units, as one illustrated above, may be placed on sturdy table top or on floor. Keep forearm flat on padded platform throughout exercise.

Lever (selectorized).name: Radial Deviation

instructions.preparation: rotate handle under and over so handle is in slightly upward position toward head. grasp handle with thumb ups grip so thumb side of fist is pulled away under resistance.
instructions.execution: bend wrist so thumb side of fist is pulled up. return to starting position and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: None.

Lever (selectorized).name: Reverse Wrist Curl

instructions.preparation: grasp handles with overhand grip to each side. place forearms on arm pads.
instructions.execution: raise handles until wrist is fully hyperextended. lower handles until wrists are fully flexed. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Keep forearms horizontal, flat on arm pads throughout exercise. See reverse wrist curl up close.

Lever (selectorized).name: Wrist Roller
Lever (selectorized).comments: Also see Lever Roller Wrist Flexion.

Stretch.name: Kneeling

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat. flex wrists and place tops of hand on floor with fingers pointing toward knees.
instructions.execution: lean against floor with elbows straight. hold stretch for 20 seconds.

Stretch.comments: Keep elbows straight.

Stretch.name: Single Arm

instructions.preparation: with palm facing downward, pull wrist and fingers downward toward forearm.
instructions.execution: extend or straighten elbow. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

Stretch.comments: Elbow may be extended first, followed by pulling palm toward forearm. Brachioradialis can also be stretched by positioining downward or back (ie: external rotation of shoulder)

Dumbbell.name: Lying Pronation

instructions.preparation: lie on bench or mat. with hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place arm on hip or side of waist. position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). return and repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Pad or firm pillow (ball pictured) may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during initial range of motion. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Dumbbell Seated Pronation. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Pronation with arm down.

Dumbbell.name: Seated Pronation

instructions.preparation: sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. with hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; pinkie positioned near weighted side. bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. position thumb upward (supinated).
instructions.execution: rotate dumbbell so thumb turns downward (pronation). return and repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with thumb against inside surface.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Pronation

instructions.preparation: sit on seat. grasp rotating handles with underhand grip on each side and place forearms on pads.
instructions.execution: rotate shafts by turning palm downward. return and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handles may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation. See forearm pronation up close.

Lever (selectorized).name: Standing Pronation

instructions.preparation: grasp open handle at end of shaft with underhand grip.
instructions.execution: rotate shaft by turning palm downward. return and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handle may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation.

Dumbbell.name: Lying Supination

instructions.preparation: lie on bench or mat. with hand of upper arm, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place forearm on hip, or side of waist. position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). return and repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Pad or firm pillow may be placed between hip and arm. Elevation of elbow allows resistance during final range of motion. If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface. Also see Dumbbell Lying Supination with arm down. This exercise can also be performed seated by corner of table higher than shoulder height (See Seated Supination).

Dumbbell.name: Seated Supination

instructions.preparation: sit next to elevated surface, approximately arm pit height. with hand of arm next to elevated surface, grasp unilaterally loaded dumbbell; thumb next to side with weight. bend elbow approximately 90-degrees and place upperarm on elevated surface. position thumb downward (pronated).
instructions.execution: rotate dumbbell so thumb turns upward (supination). return and repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: If unilaterally loaded dumbbell, or "half dumbbell" is not available, grasp conventional dumbbell to one side of handle with pinkie against inside surface.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Supination

instructions.preparation: sit on seat. grasp rotating handles with overhand grip on each side and place forearms on pads.
instructions.execution: rotate shafts by turning palm upward. return and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handles may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation. See forearm supination up close.

Lever (selectorized).name: Standing Supination

instructions.preparation: grasp open handle at end of shaft with overhand grip.
instructions.execution: rotate shaft by turning palm upward. return and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Depending on participant's range of motion and machine's design, handle may need to be prerotated so resistance is present throughout movement, particularly initial phase of rotation.

Barbell.name: Bent-over Row

instructions.preparation: bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull bar to upper waist. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either try bending knees more or don't position torso as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension and less shoulder extension range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight.Â A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension. A wide overhand grip involves overall back musculature while slightly emphasizing Rear Delt, Infraspinatus and Teres Minor involvement. Also known as Pendlay Row.

Barbell.name: Cambered Bar Lying Row

instructions.preparation: lie chest down on elevated bench. grasp cambered barbell below with overhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull bar to upper waist or lower chest. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without barbell hitting floor.

Cable.name: Incline Row

instructions.preparation: sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. slide hips down by bending knees. bend over and grasp cable attachment. slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend.
instructions.execution: pull cable attachment to waist while straightening back upright. pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. repeat.

Cable.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. See Cable Seated Row Question. Also see Cable Straight Back Incline Row and Dangerous Exercise Essay.

Cable.name: Kneeling Row

instructions.preparation: place right knee on lower pad (positioned to right side) with foot of other leg slightly back out to side and knee slightly bent. place right forearm on right side of upper pad and grasp handle. grasp cable stirrup below with left hand. allow left shoulder to be pulled forward without spinal rotation.
instructions.execution: pull stirrup up to side until elbow travels beyond surface of back. return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. repeat and continue with opposite side.

Cable.comments: Allow scapula to articulate, but do not rotate torso.

Cable.name: Lying Row

instructions.preparation: straddle head of bench and grasp stirrups on two high pulley cables. lie on bench with stirrups in each hand and arms extended upward.
instructions.execution: pull stirrups down to each side of chest until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched upward. repeat.

Cable.comments: Pulleys should not be too far apart, as they are on standard cable crossover machines. Stirrups on pulleys should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward when arms extend. Pull shoulder blades together when completing pull. Other rowing exercises should be considered if resistance required begins to exceed upper body weight since back will begin to raise up off of bench.

Cable.name: One Arm Bent-over Row

instructions.preparation: grasp cable stirrup. step back away from pulley, with foot on same side as exercising arm, positioned out to side well behind forward foot. bend over with hand on nearby bar or above knee for support. keep back straight and knees slightly bent. allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
instructions.execution: pull cable attachment to side of torso, pulling shoulder back. return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

Cable.comments: Supporting hand can also be placed on nearby bar, available on some pulley machines. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus stabilize near top of movement on forward leg.

Dumbbell.name: Bent-over Row

instructions.preparation: kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. grasp dumbbell from floor.
instructions.execution: pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. repeat and continue with opposite arm.

Dumbbell.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

Dumbbell.name: Lying Row

instructions.preparation: lie chest down on elevated bench. grasp dumbbells below.
instructions.execution: pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor.Â Exercise can also be performed on Lying Row Apparatus or Incline Bench adjusted to height close to horizontal yet high enough to permit full range of motion at lowest range of motion.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Bent-over Row

instructions.preparation: with lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. grasp lower handles.
instructions.execution: pull lever handles up to sides. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Torso should be kept horizontal if flexibility allows. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, try bending knees more. Placing weight plates on higher bar lightens resistance at top where strength lessens, without compromising range of motion. See Gravity Vectors to understand how this positioning, altering direction of load, affects exercise resistance (resistance curve). Also see wide grip form.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Incline Row

instructions.preparation: lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull lever up as high as possible. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows. Some Incline Row apparatuses allow feet to be placed on floor, particularly if foot platform cannot be adjusted to accommodate height.

Lever (plate loaded).name: One Arm Standing Row

instructions.preparation: place hand on support bar and grasp lever far forward. place foot on side of moving arm on foot support and position opposite foot behind.
instructions.execution: pull lever to side while twisting torso toward opposite side. pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. return until arm is extended and torso is pulled toward original direction. repeat. continue with opposite arm.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Unique apparatus designed and built by Tracey Cheuvront.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Seated Row (no chest pad)

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. place feet on vertically angled platform. slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
instructions.execution: pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Seated Row. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. For even greater hip and low back articulation, hips may be slid back further with knees straighter.Â See Cable Seated Row QuestionÂ andÂ Dangerous Exercise Essay. Also see Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad).

Lever (plate loaded).name: T-bar Row

instructions.preparation: bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull lever up to torso. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Keep low back straight. Lighten load if torso raises beyond 45 degrees in order to complete repetition. See Gravity Vectors to understand how load would be decreased by positioning torso too high. Also see close grip form.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated High Row

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position chest against pad. grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. Also see Hammer Equipment Lever Seated High Row, Selectorized and Plate loaded versions.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Row

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position chest against pad. push foot lever if available. grasp narrower parallel grip handles.
instructions.execution: pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Row (no chest pad)

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. place feet on vertically angled platform. slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
instructions.execution: pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to standard lever seated row machine. This exercise is more similar to Cable Seated Row. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate adaptation. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion through lower back will vary from person to person. For even greater hip and low back articulation, hips may be slid back further with knees straighter. See Cable Seated Row QuestionÂ and Dangerous Exercise Essay.Â Also see Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad).

Lever (selectorized).name: Underhand Seated Row

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position chest against pad. grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull lever handles back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

Smith.name: Bent-over Row

instructions.preparation: bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. grasp bar with wide overhand grip. disengage bar by rotating bar back.
instructions.execution: pull bar to upper waist. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. repeat.

Smith.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Platform (as shown) is only needed if smith machine does not allow bar to be lowered to lowest position. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See Hamstring Inflexibility ). If low back becomes rounded due to tight hamstrings, either knees should be bent more or torso may not be positioned as low. Either fix may compromise involvement of Latissimus Dorsi since it forces more shoulder transverse extension  and less shoulder extension  range of motion. If low back is rounded due to poor form, deadlift weight to standing position and lower torso into horizontal position with knees bent and back straight. A shoulder width or underhand grip can increase lat involvement by emphasizing shoulder extension over transverse extension.

Weighted.name: Inverted Row

instructions.preparation: lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. grasp bar with wide overhand grip. place back of heels on elevated surface.
instructions.execution: keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Weighted.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. Placing back of heels on elevated surface is optional. This exercise is typically performed without added resistance, although a weight vest can be worn or additional weight can be placed on belly or pelvis. Partner can add and remove weight, and keep weight from sliding off belly. Resistance can be further reduced by performing movement from higher bar and/or positioning heels on floor (see Inverted Row on high bar). See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of how body angle influences resistance. Also known as Weighted Body Row or Weighted Supine Row.

Body Weight.name: Inverted Row

instructions.preparation: lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Body Weight.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of body angle influences resistance. Also known as Body Row or Supine Row.

Suspended.name: Inverted Row

instructions.preparation: position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. sit on floor and grasp handles. position body supine hanging from handles with arms straight, shoulders under handles, body straight, and back of heels on floor.
instructions.execution: pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Suspended.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See Gravity Vectors for greater understanding of body angle influences resistance.

Suspended.name: Power Pull

instructions.preparation: grasp suspension handle(s) with one hand. step back until handle is chest height when held to side of chest. facing suspension apparatus with feet shoulder width apart, point other arm and its shoulder forward, parallel with angle of strap.
instructions.execution: rotate body and extended arm, reaching outward while lowering body downward by extending arm holding onto handle. extend arms and shoulders in-line with suspension strap so body is angled back to one side. return by raising body back upward in opposite motion, reaching outward and toward suspension strap while pulling handle back to side of chest until body is upright and arm parallel with angle of strap. repeat and continue with opposite side.

Suspended.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXâ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Some suspension trainer brands allow independent use of only one handle, whereas, more popular brands require either anchoring unused handle within stirrup of gripped handle or grasping both handles with one hand.

Suspended.name: Row

instructions.preparation: grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. while keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight.
instructions.execution: pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body and legs straight. return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. repeat.

Suspended.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact floor with forefeet raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright.

Stretch.name: Fixed Bar

instructions.preparation: stand facing stationary bar. grasp stationary bar with one hand approximately waist height.
instructions.execution: bend over allowing hips to fall back. slightly lean torso toward stretched arm. hold stretch. repeat with opposite side.

Stretch.comments: None

Stretch.name: Lever

instructions.preparation: sit on seat in forward position with lower legs on shin pad, feet on foot rest. place hands through wrist straps. hold upper bar with arms crossed, overhand grip.
instructions.execution: push and lower seat back. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm position.

Stretch.comments: To intensify stretch, look up or to one side.

Assisted (machine).name: Chin-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. kneel onto platform or step onto bar.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbows are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Assisted (machine).comments: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on platform or bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Also see self-assisted technique without machine.

Assisted (machine).name: Parallel Close Grip Pull-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp parallel grips. kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbows are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Assisted (machine).comments: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require standing on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation.

Assisted (machine).name: Pull-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
instructions.execution: pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Assisted (machine).comments: See suggested mount and dismount. Some assisted machines require you to stand on bar. If no assisted machine is used, assist as needed by allowing training partner to pull feet up behind legs or push self up with legs on elevation. Range of motion will decrease if grip is too wide.

Barbell.name: Pullover

instructions.preparation: lie upper back perpendicular on bench. flex hips slightly. grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
instructions.execution: with elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. return and repeat.

Barbell.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see Barbell Bent Arm Pullover.

Cable.name: Close Grip Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp parallel cable attachment. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down cable attachment to upper chest. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: Exercise can be performed withÂ V-Bar or Multi-exercise Bar.

Cable.name: Kneeling Bent-over Pulldown

instructions.preparation: kneel on mat slightly away from high pulley. grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. sit with hips back and bend down by flexing hips so torso is bent over at approximately 30Âº angle. allow resistance on cable pulley to pull arms upward with elbows bent.
instructions.execution: pull cable rope down until elbows are back and inside of rope attachment is behind neck. return attachment over head until shoulder is completely flexed upward. repeat.

Cable.comments: Keep hips and torso in same position throughout movement.

Cable.name: Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp cable bar with wide grip. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down cable bar to upper chest. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

Cable.name: Pullover

instructions.preparation: lie upper back perpendicular on bench. flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. pull to position cable attachment over chest. fix elbows with small bend.
instructions.execution: lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are in-line with upper torso. raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. repeat.

Cable.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.

Cable.name: Underhand Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp cable bar with underhand grip. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down cable bar to upper chest until elbows are to sides. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Cable.comments: None

Lever (plate loaded).name: Close Grip Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp handles and sit with thighs under padded supports.
instructions.execution: pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Erector Spinae can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Front Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp lever bar with wide grip. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down lever bar to upper chest. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp handles to each side with overhand grip. sit on seat and position thighs under leg pads.
instructions.execution: pull levers down to sides of shoulders. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: None

Lever (plate loaded).name: Pullover

instructions.preparation: adjust seat height so lever is near shoulder axis. sit on machine. place elbows on pads and grasp bar from behind.
instructions.execution: pull lever forward and down until elbows are to sides. return until shoulders are fully flexed, or upper arms are parallel to torso. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Rear Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp lever bar with wide grip. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull lever bar down behind neck. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Underhand Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp lever handles with underhand grip. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down lever handles toward sides until elbows are to sides. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: See pad kick down on Hammer Machine. Also see movement on alternative machine.

Lever (selectorized).name: Close Grip Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp parallel lever bars. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down handles to sides of chest while leaning back slightly. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Erector Spinae can become slightly engaged when torso arches back.

Lever (selectorized).name: Front Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp lever handles. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down lever to upper chest. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: None

Lever (selectorized).name: Iron Cross

instructions.preparation: stand on platform and grasp handles to sides with palms down grip.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, pull lever handles down below hips. return lever handles upward just above shoulder high, or just before slight pressure in shoulder is felt. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Platform should be adjusted so shoulder joint and girdle are approximate height as lever fulcrum. Also See Bent-over Fly on Iron Cross   Machine.

Lever (selectorized).name: Pulldown

instructions.preparation: sit on seat. reach up and grasp handles with wide overhand grip.
instructions.execution: pull levers down to sides of shoulders. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. See Lever Pulldown performed on alternative apparatus. Also see exercise with parallel grip.

Lever (selectorized).name: Pullover

instructions.preparation: adjust seat height so lever is near shoulder axis. sit on machine and push foot lever. place elbows on pads and grasp bar from behind. release foot lever and place feet on platform or to sides.
instructions.execution: pull lever forward and down until elbows are to sides. return until shoulders are fully flexed, or upper arms are parallel to torso. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: When finished, push foot lever before releasing arm from lever. Release foot lever after releasing arm from lever. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility.

Lever (selectorized).name: Underhand Pulldown

instructions.preparation: grasp lever handles with underhand grip. sit with thighs under supports.
instructions.execution: pull down lever handles to sides until elbows are to sides. return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: See pad kick down on Hammer Machine. Also see exercise on alternative machine.

Weighted.name: Chin-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbows are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Weighted.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles. Also seeÂ Chin-upÂ without added weight.

Weighted.name: Parallel Close Grip Pull-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp close grip parallel bars.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbow are to sides. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Weighted.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles.Â Also seeÂ Parallel Close Grip Pull-upÂ without added weight.

Weighted.name: Pull-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
instructions.execution: pull body up until chin is above bar. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Weighted.comments: Added weight can be placed on dip belt or dumbbell can be placed between ankles as shown. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.Â Also seeÂ Pull-upÂ without added weight.

Band-assisted.name: Pull-up

instructions.preparation: grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. reach up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip while keeping banded leg straight.
instructions.execution: pull body up until chin is above bar. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Band-assisted.comments: Free foot can be placed on top of foot in band forÂ safety in case band slips from foot.Â Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

Band-assisted.name: Rear Pull-up

instructions.preparation: grasp middle ofÂ hanging exercise band and pull down to side of leg. lift foot and hook band under heel. stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. face perpendicular under pullup bar and position band behind body. pull band apart and place other foot onto band so both feet are together inside of band. reach up and grasp pull-up bar with overhand wide grip while keepingÂ legs straight.
instructions.execution: pull body up until bar touches back of neck. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Band-assisted.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. At conclusion of set, stepÂ one foot out of band at bottom of exercises. Grasping each side of exercise band from behind and pull down. Transfer body weight onto free leg, bend knee of banded leg, release band from underfoot, and step out. Transfer both sides of taut band to one hand behind body. Turn body to side of hand holding band while permitting band to contract to normal length.

Body Weight.name: Stability Ball Rollout

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat facing stability ball within arm's reach. straighten hips with subtle bend. also straighten arms with slight bend, down in front of body. place fists side by side on upper side of ball closest to hips.
instructions.execution: lean forward and roll ridged arms out over ball. roll forward as far as possible. raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. repeat.

Body Weight.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Stability Ball Kneeling Rollout.

Body Weight.name: Wheel Rollout

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat. grasp handles on wheel to each side with overhand grip. position wheel near front of knees and lean over wheel with arms extended downward, supporting upper body.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, roll wheel out as far as possible. lower body gently to floor extending arms forward. raise body back up by flexing hips and pulling arms back to original position. return until hips are extended. repeat.

Body Weight.comments: Keep elbows straight or nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Wheel Kneeling Rollout. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques practically contract isometrically since little waist flexion occurs under resistance. With no waist flexion, Rectus Abdominis and External Oblique act to stabilize pelvis and waist during hip flexion. See target muscle of rollout question. Also see Spot Reduction Myth and Lower Ab Myth.

Assisted (partner).name: Chin-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
instructions.execution: pull body up until elbows are to sides or chin is just above bar. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Assisted (partner).comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Also see self-assisted technique.

Assisted (partner).name: Pull-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
instructions.execution: pull body up until chin is just above bar. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Assisted (partner).comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Exercise can be used until Pull-ups can be performed. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide .

Assisted (partner).name: Rear Pull-up

instructions.preparation: step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip. bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
instructions.execution: pull body up until bar touches back of neck. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Assisted (partner).comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

Self-assisted.name: Chin-up

instructions.preparation: stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. grasp bar with underhand grip shoulder width. position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
instructions.execution: lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. pull body up until elbows are to sides, again with minimal assistance from lower body. repeat.

Self-assisted.comments: If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine.

Self-assisted.name: Pull-up

instructions.preparation: stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. grasp bar with wide overhand grip. position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
instructions.execution: lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. pull body up until chin is just above bar, again with minimal assistance from legs. repeat.

Self-assisted.comments: If lower body is used for assistance, Hip and Knee Extensors muscles are utilized. Back extensors may be activated minimally as stabilizer through spine. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide.

Self-assisted.name: Rear Pull-up

instructions.preparation: grasp bar with overhand wide grip. position forefeet on floor just behind low bar or on bench just behind high bar.
instructions.execution: lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. if necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent allowing knees to bend. pull body up until bar touches back of neck, again with minimal assistance from lower body. repeat.

Self-assisted.comments: If bar is too low, knees may need to spread apart at bottom of motion (as shown) to achieve full range of motion. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is too wide. If lower body is used for assistance, Quadriceps are utilized.

Suspension.name: Pull-up

instructions.preparation: grasp high suspension handles.
instructions.execution: pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. repeat.

Suspension.comments: This exercise can be performed on adjustable length gymnastics rings or a dual anchored suspension trainer where the handles can be placed a short distance apart. Performing this exercise on a TRXâ style suspension trainer would require a narrower grip, with the hands closer together.

Suspended.name: Suspended Rollout

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat and grasp suspension trainer handles. position body upright with subtle bend through hip. also, straighten arms in front of body with slight bend.
instructions.execution: lean body forward while maintaining small bend in hip. allow arms to bend forward to sides of head. bend over as far as possible. raise body back up by pulling arms back until kneeling upright in original position. repeat.

Suspended.comments: Try to keep elbows nearly straight throughout exercise. Target muscle, Rectus Abdominis practically contracts isometrically since only a small degree of waist flexion occurs under resistance and, with the assistance of the External Oblique, act to stabilize spine. See target muscle of rollout question. Also see Spot Reduction Myth and Lower Ab Myth.

Stretch.name: Bar

instructions.preparation: standing distance facing bar approximately lower chest height. grasp bar with both hands. lean body forward so bar is behind/under bar and arms are to sides of head. feet are keep away from bar.
instructions.execution: allow upper body to hang downward while keeping arms to sides of head. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Triceps become more involved if shoulders are keep close to wrists.

Stretch.name: Bent-over

instructions.preparation: kneel on mat or floor. extend arms well beyond knees and place forearms on floor.
instructions.execution: lower torso as far down as possible and sit back. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Lever
Stretch.comments: To intensify stretch, look up or to one side.

Stretch.name: Overhead

instructions.preparation: put one arm overhead. grasp elbow or wrist overhead with other hand.
instructions.execution: pull elbow toward head and back or pull arm down toward opposite shoulder. lean torso to side, away from direction of arm behind head. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

Stretch.comments: Avoid overstressing neck anteriorly. See Overhead Triceps Stretch for similar exercise which can be performed with this stretch.

Stretch.name: Seated Side Reach

instructions.preparation: sit on bench or floor. place one arm down to side on bench or floor, slightly behind for support. put opposite arm overhead.
instructions.execution: lean and reach to side away from raised arm. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

Stretch.comments: Allow shoulder to raise toward side of head for greater stretch.

Stretch.name: Supine Lat

instructions.preparation: lie supine on mat or floor. position arms parallel to body pointing opposite direction of legs.
instructions.execution: pull arms toward floor and back sides of head. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Stretch can also be performed with feet on floor and legs bent if participant is sensitive to spinal hyperextension.

Stretch.name: Standing Side Reach

instructions.preparation: stand with feet far apart. place one arm on side of thigh. put opposite arm overhead.
instructions.execution: lean and reach to side away from raised arm. hold stretch. repeat with opposite arm.

Stretch.comments: Allow shoulder to raise toward side of head for greater stretch.

Stretch.name: Wall

instructions.preparation: standing toward wall. bend over and place palms of hands on wall, approximately shoulder width and waist height.
instructions.execution: lower torso. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Alternatively, forearms can be placed on wall, parallel with elbows pointed downward.

Barbell.name: Cambered Bar Seated Shrug

instructions.preparation: sit on end of bench and grasp cambered bar from beneath with overhand or mixed grip.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Barbell.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Barbell.name: Shrug

instructions.preparation: stand holding barbell with overhand or mixed grip; shoulder width or slightly wider.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Barbell.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Barbell.name: Trap Bar Shrug

instructions.preparation: step into trap barbell and stand holding handles of trap bar to sides.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Barbell.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Cable.name: Shrug

instructions.preparation: stand facing low pulley and grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. stand close to pulley.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Cable.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Cable.name: Shrug with Stirrups

instructions.preparation: stand between two low pulleys and grasp stirrups to each side. stand upright with arms straight down to each side.
instructions.execution: with arms straight, elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Cable.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Dumbbell.name: Shrug

instructions.preparation: stand holding dumbbells to sides.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Exercise may be performed standing perfectly upright or very slightly bent over. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Gripless Shrug

instructions.preparation: stand with shoulders under padded lever.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Shrug

instructions.preparation: stand between lever handles to sides. squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp upper handles to sides. stand upright by extending hips and knees to full extension.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria and Shoulder Shrug Errors.

Lever (selectorized).name: Gripless Shrug

instructions.preparation: stand with shoulders under padded lever.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: If possible, position lever height high enough so weight will not need to be squat up that high, but not so high that weight stack bottoms out during exercise. Since this movement becomes more difficult as full shoulder elevation is achieved, height criteria for shoulder elevation may be needed. For example, raising shoulders until slope of shoulders becomes horizontal may be considered adequate depending upon individual body structure and range of motion with lighter weight. Also see ROM Criteria.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Gripless Shrug

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and place forearms in padded bars.
instructions.execution: elevate shoulders as high as possible. lower and repeat.
