Stretch.comments: Keep knees straight by tensing Quadriceps. Knees may inadvertently bend if feet are extended off of thick mat. Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

Stretch.name: Seated (Chair or Exercise Ball)

instructions.preparation: sit on edge of chair or exercise ball. position heels on floor with knees straight.
instructions.execution: reach toward toes or bring torso toward legs. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Precautions must be taken to prevent sliping off chair. This stretch may be appropriate for those restricted to chair. Keep knees straight by tensing Quadriceps. Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

Stretch.name: Seated Single Leg (Bench)

instructions.preparation: sit on bench. place one leg on bench with knee straight.
instructions.execution: reach toward foot or bring torso toward leg on bench. hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Keep knees straight by tensing Quadriceps. The knee may inadvertently bend if foot is extended off edge of bench. Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

Stretch.name: Standing

instructions.preparation: stand and bend over with knees straight.
instructions.execution: reach toward toes or floor or bring torso toward legs. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Keep knees straight by tensing Quadriceps. Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

Dynamic Stretch.name: Soldier Kick

instructions.preparation: stand and step forward with left foot.
instructions.execution: next step, extend left arm forward while swinging right leg up so foot touches or comes close to hand. lower right leg. repeat with same sequence on opposite side. continue by alternating between each side until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

Dynamic Stretch.comments: This Dynamic Stretch can performed before athletic event or sports training session. Although this dynamic stretch targets the Hamstrings in the raised leg, Iliopsoas is typically stretched in supporting leg due to posterior rotation of hips as leg is raised.

Cable.name: Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: stand in front of low pulley facing to one side. attach cable cuff to near ankle. step out away from stack with wide stance and grasp ballet bar. stand on far foot and allow near leg to be pulled toward low pulley.
instructions.execution: move near leg just in front of far leg by abduction hip. return and repeat. turn around and continue with opposite leg.

Cable.comments: Notice cable pulley in use is out of view to left. Exerciser is holding on to ballet bar above opposite cable pulley, not in use. See Spot Reduction Myth.

Cable.name: Lying Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: stand or sit in front of low pulley and attach cable cuff to ankle. step away from pulley toward opposite pull, pulling weight plates up just far enough get next to opposite cable pulley. attach other cable cuff to opposite ankle. sit so hips are between both low pulley cables to each side. lie down on back and lift legs up vertically.
instructions.execution: lower legs apart out to each side until stretch is felt in inner thigh. raise legs together. return and repeat.

Cable.comments: See Spot Reduction Myth.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Seated Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and lift one leg onto padded lever. lean back onto back pad. grasp handles attatched to leg levers. push handles together and raise other leg onto other padded lever. release leg lever handles and grasp other handles to each side.
instructions.execution: move legs together until leg levers make contact. allow legs to seperate far apart until slight stretch and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: See Spot Reduction Myth.

Lever (selectorized).name: Lying Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: sit in machine with legs outside of vertical center pads. if available, place heels on foot bars. lie back on back pad. disengage and pull lever brace to position legs apart until slight stretch is felt. engage lever into locked position. lie back and grasp bars to sides.
instructions.execution: move legs together. return and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Mount machine with leg levers together. Use lever to extend legs apart. See Spot Reduction Myth.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: sit in machine with legs outside of vertical center pads. if available, place heels on foot bars. disengage and pull lever brace to position legs apart until slight stretch is felt. engage lever into locked position. lie back and grasp bars to sides.
instructions.execution: move legs together. return and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Mount machine with leg levers together. Use lever to extend legs apart. See Spot Reduction Myth.

Lever (selectorized).name: Standing Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: adjust platform so lever fulcrum is same height as hip articulation. adjust roller pad to side position. face machine and grasp bars to sides. place inside of thigh on roller pad and remain standing on supporting leg.
instructions.execution: move leg toward and across supporting leg return and repeat. reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.

Lever (selectorized).comments: See Spot Reduction Myth.

Weighted.name: Lying Hip Adduction

instructions.preparation: sit on floor or mat with bar, weight plates loaded on one side. sit on hip with knees bent and place bar on inside of shoe with weight plate beyond foot. holding on to opposite end of bar, lie on side with weighted leg extended out straight and upper leg extended behind.
instructions.execution: raise weighted leg up off floor as high as possible while balanciong bar inside of foot and holding onto nearest side of bar. return to floor and repeat. repeat and continue with opposite leg.

Weighted.comments: See Spot Reduction Myth and ROM Criteria.

Body Weight.name: Angled Side Bridge

instructions.preparation: place forearm on padded elevated surface, positioned perpendicular to body. position feet out away from elevated surface, one foot in front of other with hips and knees straight. place free hand on upper hip and allow lower hip and waist to bend downward.
instructions.execution: raise hips upward by lateral flexion of spine. lower to original position and repeat. repeat with opposite side.

Body Weight.comments: One of very few body weight exercises that directly exercises side deltoid in relatively full range of motion. In addition to lateral flexion of spine, lower hip abducts and upper hip adducts. See Spot Reduction Myth.

Body Weight.name: Bent Knee Side Bridge

instructions.preparation: lie on side on mat. place forearm on mat under shoulder perpendicular to body. bend knees at a right angle. place upper leg directly on top of lower leg and straighten hips.
instructions.execution: raise hips upward by lateral flexion of spine. lower to original position and repeat. repeat with opposite side.

Body Weight.comments: In addition to lateral flexion of spine, lower hip abducts and upper hip adducts. Exercise can also be performed isometrically, see Bent Knee Side Plank. Gracilis of upper leg enters into active insufficiency with hip extended and knee flexed. Also see Spot Reduction Myth.

Body Weight.name: Side Bridge

instructions.preparation: lie on side on mat. place forearm on mat under shoulder perpendicular to body. place upper leg directly on top of lower leg and straighten knees and hips.
instructions.execution: raise hips upward by lateral flexion of spine. lower to original position and repeat. repeat with opposite side.

Body Weight.comments: In addition to lateral flexion of spine, lower hip abducts and upper hip adducts. Exercise can also be performed isometrically, see Side Plank. Also see Spot Reduction Myth.

Suspended.name: Side Bend

instructions.preparation: grasp handles, step away, and face body to one side of suspension trainer anchor. hold handles above head with arms bent. stand far enough away to make suspension trainer straps taut. step in just enough to achieve desired lean of body, while keeping tension on suspension trainer straps.
instructions.execution: lower hips away from direction of suspension trainer anchor by laterally flexing spine. return to original upright position and repeat. reposition body facing opposite direction. continue with other side.

Suspended.comments: Suspension handle(s) can also be gripped with both hands together with either one hand over other hand or with interlaced fingers. In addition to lateral flexion of spine, lower hip abducts and upper hip adducts. Also see Spot Reduction Myth. This exercise can be performed on TRXâ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

Suspended.name: Side Bridge

instructions.preparation: sit on floor or mat, facing suspension trainer loops in low position. grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. extend legs out with one leg crossed over other. turn on side of lower leg so legs are parallel. place forearm on mat or floor under shoulder perpendicular to body.
instructions.execution: raise hips upward by lateral flexion of spine. lower to original position and repeat. reposition to opposite side and continue.

Suspended.comments: In addition to lateral flexion of spine, lower hip abducts and upper hip adducts. This exercise can be performed on TRXâ style suspension trainer. More popular suspension trainers allow limited slippage, so loop around lower leg can be positioned below loop of upper leg once on side (as shown). Other models can be adjusted, so strap on lower leg is slightly longer than strap on upper leg.Â Alternatively, see alternative positioningÂ with one foot can be positioned behind other with only feet being placed in stirrups. Also see Spot Reduction Myth.

Stretch.name: Kneeling Groin

instructions.preparation: kneel with feet pointed out to sides. place forearms and hands on floor.
instructions.execution: spread knees apart and gently lower hips. hold stretch for 20 seconds.

Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Kneeling Side Lunge

instructions.preparation: kneel on floor or mat. place one foot pointing out and somewhat perpendicular to opposite kneeling leg.
instructions.execution: shift upright body toward supporting foot. hold stretch. repeat on opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Push elbow into side of knee for added stretch.

Stretch.name: Lever

instructions.preparation: sit on seat in forward position. place hands through wrist straps. hold lower bar with overhand grip. position soles of feet together on top edge of shin pad.
instructions.execution: push and lower seat back. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: emphasizes Adductor Magnus, ischial fibers by flexing hip.

Stretch.name: Lying Groin

instructions.preparation: lie on floor or mat. place soles of feet together on floor close to body with knees far apart.
instructions.execution: lower knees toward floor. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Arms can push legs down if preferred.

Stretch.name: Lying Wall Groin

instructions.preparation: sit on floor with hip and thigh against wall. lift back of legs up against wall by pivoting on hips and lying on back. place back of legs against wall.
instructions.execution: spread legs. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Keep back of legs against wall.

Stretch.name: Seated Groin

instructions.preparation: sit on floor or mat with soles of feet together on floor and close to body. grasp feet with both hands and position elbows on inside of lower legs.
instructions.execution: press knees toward floor with elbows. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Erector Spinae may be stretched if spine is flexed during stretch. Gluteus Maximus may be stretched if hip is flexed enough.

Stretch.name: Side Lunge

instructions.preparation: stand with feet far apart, toes pointed 45Â° outward.
instructions.execution: lunge toward one side. allow foot of straight leg to point upward with heel on floor. hold stretch. repeat on opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Keep back straight during stretch. Gracilis is stretched on straight leg.

Stretch.name: Squatting Groin

instructions.preparation: stand with feet pointed approximately 45Â° outward. squat down completely with knees pointed outward over toes. place palms of hands on floor with inside of upper arm positioned against inner thigh.
instructions.execution: pull thighs apart with upper arms. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Keep feet flat on floor and knees pointed same direction as toes. emphasizes Adductor Magnus, ischial fibers by flexing hip.

Stretch.name: Standing Groin

instructions.preparation: stand next to upper thigh height surface off to side. hold onto elevated surface or other stable structure for balance and place inner side of nearest bent lower leg on elevated surface.
instructions.execution: lower body slightly by bending knee of base leg until stretch if felt. repeat on opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Place hands on hips or keep hand on elevated surface or other stable structure for balance.

Stretch.name: Bent-over

instructions.preparation: stand with one foot on chair or bench. bend over.
instructions.execution: reach toward floor. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Kneeling

instructions.preparation: kneel with one foot on floor or mat. position torso to inside of upper thigh with hands on floor.
instructions.execution: lower torso downward. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Other heads of hip adductors may be stretched if knee of upper leg travels out to side during stretch.

Stretch.name: Lying

instructions.preparation: lie supine on floor or mat. raise knees and grasp back of thighs behind knees.
instructions.execution: pull knee toward shoulders or to side of torso while keeping opposite leg on floor. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Keeping lower leg straight keeps pelvis from tilting so upper knee does not have to come back as far. Gluteus Maximus is stretched if hips are slightly external rotated. Piriformis and Quadratus Femoris become stretched if hip is slightly transversely adducted (knee toward opposite side of chest).

Stretch.name: Seated Single Leg

instructions.preparation: sit on floor or mat and place outside of flexed leg on floor. over that leg, position opposite leg with foot flat on floor and back of heel against shin.
instructions.execution: bent torso forward. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Other heads of hip adductors can be stretched if knee of upper leg travels out to side during stretch.

Stretch.name: Seated

instructions.preparation: sit on floor or mat with feet far apart and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. reach forward grasp bottom of feet.
instructions.execution: pull torso forward and hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Back may be keep straight. Other heads of Hip Adductors can be stretched if legs are positioned out as far as possible.

Barbell.name: Safety Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height and calf block on floor just below. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. place hands on bar to each sides or on vertical rack bars. position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. dismount bar from rack by standing erect with safety bar, away yet close to rack.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Calf block should be positioned so safety bar is close to but does not make contact with rack. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Barbell.name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: set barbell on power rack upper chest height with calf block under barbell. position back of shoulders under barbell with both hands to sides. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. lean barbell against rack and raise from supports by extending knees and hips. support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Notice barbell makes contact with only non-painted surface (plastic or metal surface). Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Cable.name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place cable belt or dip belt around waist. kneel before low pulley and attach belt to cable. stand on calf block and grasp support bar for balance. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Cable.comments: Chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See Calf Exercise Analyses. Also see same movement performed on slightly different apparatus, Lever Standing Calf Raise (belt loaded).

Dumbbell.name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. place hand on support for balance.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. If holding heavy dumbbell becomes too difficult, try single leg calf raise. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: 45Â° Calf Press

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with back on padded support. place feet on platform. grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
instructions.execution: push platform by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: 45Â° Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. place feet high on platform and straighten knees. position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with arches and heels extending off.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Calf Extension

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position forefeet on lever platform. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: push lever by extending ankle as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Rotary Calf Extension. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Donkey Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position lower back and hips under padded lever. place forearms on supports. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. straighten knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Seated Calf Press

instructions.preparation: place seat away from platform. sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform(s) with heels and arches extending off. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: push lever platform(s) by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Position seat back yet not so far that lever bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place shoulders under padded lever. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. grasp handles or sides of padded lever. stand erect by extending hips and knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: If available, position lever or chain just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: 45Â° Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform or foot bar with arches and heels extending off. straighten knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Calf Extension

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position forefeet on horizontal foot bar. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown). Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Donkey Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position lower back and hips under padded lever. place forearms on supports. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. straighten knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Calf Press

instructions.preparation: place seat away from platform. sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Position seat back yet not so far that weight bottoms out (weight stack hits bottom) during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place shoulders under padded lever. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. grasp handles or sides of padded lever. stand erect by extending hips and knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: 45Â° Calf Press

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with back on padded support. place feet on platform. grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
instructions.execution: push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Movement can also be performed on Bilateral 45Â° Leg Press apparatus. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: 45Â° Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with lower back against padding and grasp handles to sides. position toes and balls of feet on foot platform with arches and heels extending off. straighten knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Sled Donkey Calf Raise. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Donkey Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position lower back and hips under upper pad. place forearms on supports. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. straighten knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Position upper pad just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Hack Calf Press

instructions.preparation: lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
instructions.execution: push sled up away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Not all Hack Squat machines have platform with opened lower end allowing for this movement, but some platforms may accommodate calf block, see example. Disengage docking lever if it impedes movements. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Lying Calf Press

instructions.preparation: position sled away from platform. lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
instructions.execution: push sled away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Position sled back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place shoulders under padded bars. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. grasp handles or sides of padded bars. stand erect by extending hips and knees.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Position sled just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also see exercise on alternative apparatus with back pad. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Vertical Calf Press

instructions.preparation: lie on back pad. place feet on platform. grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. place toes and balls of feet on platform with heels and arches extending off.
instructions.execution: push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Sled.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Smith.name: Donkey Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: engage both safety stops mid height so bar will be just above in lowest range of motion. place calf block under bar. position padded surface of tall bench or roman chair in front of smith machine for arm rest. place stiffly padded board within arms reach. step on calf block while standing between smith bar and arm rest. situate padded board on back of hips while bending under smith bar. arrange smith bar above upper hips or lower waist with padded board in between. place forearms on supports. lift bar off of safety stops by straighten knees. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Smith.comments: Position smith bar just below lowest range of motion. Weight can be loaded with or without bar catch engaged. In event bar catch obstructs movement mid-set, reach back with one hand and rotate bar to move bar catch out of way. If this is not possible, lower weight, adjust catch, and start again. When set has been completed lower bar to safety catch by bending knees. Make certain both safety catches are secure before each set.

Smith.name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position bar on upper chest height and place calf block under bar. position back of shoulders under bar and grasp bar to sides. position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. disengage bar by rotating bar back. stand erect by extending knees and hips.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Smith.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also see alternative form: Standing Calf Pop-ups involving Quadriceps. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Weighted.name: Donkey Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: stand on edge of platform, toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. bend over and grasp knee high bar (as shown) or place forearms on thigh high surface (see example). allow training partner to mount hips or lower back from bench.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Weighted.comments: Torso should be approximately parallel to floor. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as SynergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Exercise is more challenging with training partner toward hips sitting upright. Also, training partner can hold additional weight in arms. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Weighted.name: Single Leg Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: hang weight from dip belt around waist. position toes and ball of foot on calf block end of platform with heel and arch extending off. place hand or hands on support for balance. lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
instructions.execution: raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. repeat. continue with opposite leg.

Weighted.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Use lighter load if you need to assist with hands used for support. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Body Weight.name: Standing Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. place hand on support for balance.
instructions.execution: raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Body Weight.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Body Weight.name: Single Leg Forward Angled Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: stand facing mid-thigh to hip high vertical bar. grasp bar with wide overhand grip. step back so body is angled forward with body straight and arms extended approximately perpendicular to body. feet should be pointed forward. lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
instructions.execution: raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. allow body to travel forward and upward in same direction as body is orientated. lower heel allowing foot to come back down flat on floor. repeat. continue with opposite leg.

Body Weight.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch.

Self-assisted.name: Single Leg Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position toes and balls of feet on calf block with heels and arches extending off. place hands on support for assistance. lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
instructions.execution: raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible, assisting with upper body as little as possible. lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. repeat. continue with opposite leg.

Self-assisted.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Clip shows use of pulling assistance from high support. If support is lower, assist by pushing on support.   See Calf Exercise Analyses. Also see technique with assistance from opposite leg.

Suspended.name: Single Leg Forward Angled Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: stand facing suspension trainer handles positioned hip to waist high. grasp handles with overhand grip. step back so body is angled forward with arms extended approximately perpendicular to body. feet should be pointed forward. lift one leg forward by flexing at hip and knee.
instructions.execution: raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. allow body to travel forward and upward in same direction as body is orientated. lower heel allowing foot to come back down flat on floor. repeat. continue with opposite leg.

Suspended.comments: Keep knee of supporting leg straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergistÂ muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch.

Stretch.name: Floor Board

instructions.preparation: face wall with both knees slightly bent. position fore foot on wall with heel on floor.
instructions.execution: straighten knees and lean body toward wall. hold stretch . repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Lunging

instructions.preparation: stand with one leg far forward and other leg extended back with knees straight. both feet are positioned directly forward.
instructions.execution: lower body forward by bending forward knee only. hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Keep knee of rear leg straight and both feet flat on floor. Keep upper body upright. Experiment with positioning feet further apart so minimum bending of forward knee is required.

Stretch.name: Pike
Stretch.comments: Although angle of ankles increase as hands travel closer to feet (requiring less ankle/Gastrocnemius flexibility), angle of hips decreases (requiring more hip/Hamstrings flexibility). As hamstrings are stretched through hip, they pull on gastrocnemius due to intertwining contact hamstrings have on gastrocnemius behind knee.

Stretch.name: Step

instructions.preparation: position toes and balls of feet on stair step or calf block with arches and heels extending off. use railing or wall for balance.
instructions.execution: with knees straight, shift body weight to one foot. hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: None

Stretch.name: Towel

instructions.preparation: sit of floor or mat and place towel or band under foot. with both ends of towel or band in each hand, straighten leg with towel under foot.
instructions.execution: pull towel and hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Opposite leg may be keep bent or straight off to side.

Stretch.name: Wall

instructions.preparation: place both hands on wall with arms extended. lean against wall with one leg bent forward and other leg extended back with knee straight and foot positioned directly forward.
instructions.execution: push rear heal to floor and move hips slightly forward. hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: None.

Barbell.name: Safety Barbell Seated Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place safety bar on rack approximately lower leg height with calf block slightly rear of safety bar. sit on bench facing safety bar and place toes on lower portion of platform with heels extending off. scoot forward to edge of bench and position lower thighs under safety bar. grasp bar to sides and lift bar from rack by pushing heels up. slide back to center of bench.
instructions.execution: lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Slide forward to edge of bench and rack safety bar when finished. See suggested mount & dismount. Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in active insufficiency since knees are significantly bent. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Seated Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on seat facing lever. place forefeet on platform with heels extending off. position lower thighs under lever pads. grasp handles if available or place hands on lever pad. lift lever slightly by pushing heels up. release support lever.
instructions.execution: lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in active insufficiency since knees are significantly bent. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Calf Extension

instructions.preparation: with leg pads in upper position, sit on seat and place feet on lever platform with legs under pads. lower leg pads on legs so they are snuggly adjusted just behind knees.Â place hands on top of thigh pads.
instructions.execution: push lever platform down by extending ankles as far as possible. return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: This machine design is very rare in comparison to Lever Seated Calf Raise machine. This particular machineÂ was missing its adjustable leg pad so fists were placed between legs and cross bar.Â Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in active insufficiency since knees are significantly bent. SeeÂ Calf Exercise Analyses.

Smith.name: Seated Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position bar slightly higher than lower leg height. wrap bar pad around center of bar. place calf block under bar and bench near bar. sit on bench facing bar and place toes on lower portion of platform with heels extending off. grasp bar to sides and extend ankles to raise knees so lower thighs are under padded bar. push heels further up. disengage bar by rotating bar back.
instructions.execution: lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. repeat.

Smith.comments: Safety stops can be used to support bar at lowest position, particularly if it is difficult to rack bar to original height. If possible, adjust height of bench or calf block so thigh is close to horizontal. Movement is predominately Soleus. Gastrocnemius are in active insufficiency since knees are significantly bent. See Calf Exercise Analyses.

Stretch.name: Floor Board

instructions.preparation: face wall with both knees slightly bent. position fore foot on wall with heel on floor.
instructions.execution: straighten knee of rear leg and lean body toward wall. hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Keep knee of stretched leg bent.

Stretch.name: Lunging

instructions.preparation: stand with one leg far forward and other leg extended back with knees straight. both feet are positioned directly forward.
instructions.execution: squat down by flexing both knees just before rear heel raises off floor. hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Keep both feet flat on floor. Upper body may be keep upright. Experiment with positioning feet further apart so minimum bending of knees are required.

Stretch.name: Pike
Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Kneeling

instructions.preparation: kneel on lower leg. place foot of opposite leg flat on floor.
instructions.execution: lean forward so knee travels beyond toes. hold stretch . repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Keep foot flat on floor.

Stretch.name: Seated

instructions.preparation: sit of floor or mat. place heel on floor or mat with bent knee upright. grasp top of forefoot.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot toward shin. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Opposite leg may be keep bent or straight off to side. Also see similar exercise Seated Plantar Fascia Stretch.

Stretch.name: Step

instructions.preparation: position toes and balls of feet on stair step or calf block with arches and heels extending off. place support leg up to higher steps. use railing or wall for balance. bend rear knee.
instructions.execution: allow rear heel to lower below step. hold stretch for 20 seconds. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Towel

instructions.preparation: sit of floor or mat. with both ends of towel or band in each hand, place towel or band under foot.
instructions.execution: with knee bent, pull towel and hold stretch. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: Opposite leg may be keep bent or straight off to side.

Stretch.name: Wall

instructions.preparation: place both hands on wall with arms extended. lean against wall with one leg bent forward and other leg extended back. bend rear knee slightly, positioned foot directly forward, and place heal to floor.
instructions.execution: lower knee until just before heel raises. hold stretch for 20 seconds. repeat with opposite leg.

Stretch.comments: None.

Barbell.name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place barbell on power rack upper chest height and calf block under barbell. position back of shoulders under barbell with both hands to sides. position heels on forward edge of calf block. lean barbell against rack and raise from supports by extending knees and hips. support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Throughout exercise, keep knees and hips straight and support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides. The exercise can be made more difficult by positionin   g heels closer to edge of platform. Notice barbell makes contact with only non-painted surface (plastic or metal surface). See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Barbell.name: Safety Bar Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height and calf block on floor just below. position heels on forward edge of calf block. place hands on bar to each sides or on vertical rack bars. position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. dismount bar from rack by standing erect with safety bar, away yet close to rack.
instructions.execution: pull forefeet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Barbell.comments: Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Calf block should be positioned so safety bar is close to but does not make contact with rack. Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Cable.name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place cable belt or dip belt around waist. kneel before low pulley and attach it to cable. stand and position heels on forward edge of platform. grasp support bar for balance.
instructions.execution: pull forefeet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Cable.comments: A short chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Dumbbell.name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. position heels on forward edge of platform. grasp support with other hand for balance.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Dumbbell.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by using only one leg or positioning heels closer to edge of platform. If you need to assist with hands used for support, use lighter load (or no weight), or position heels more on platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: 45Â° Reverse Calf Press

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with back on padded support. place feet very high on platform, grasp handles to sides, and extend knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: 45Â° Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with lower back against padding. grasp handles to sides and place feet on top portion of platform. straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet return to platform. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: When finished, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Feet should be place highest position that still allows forefeet to make contact with platform. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Exercise is performed on apparatus design to perform Hack Press. Also see similar movement performed on Sled Donkey Calf Machine. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place shoulders under padded lever. stand erect by extending hips and knees. position heels on forward edge of platform placed under padded lever. grasp handles or sides of padded lever.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform as well as adding weight. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Reverse Calf Extension

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position heels on lever platform with fore feet extended off top. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Care must be taken to avoid heels from slipping off platform. Begin with very light weight to insure shoes have adequate traction. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Seated Tibia Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on bench or stool. place both feet under padded lever with heels on pedal.
instructions.execution: lift forefeet upward as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Avoid using other muscles to push pedal down with heels as lever is lifted. Insure full range of motion is practiced. In starting lower position, scoot back on bench just slightly until full planter flexion is felt. Establish range of motion criteria for highest position. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (plate loaded).name: Standing Tibia Raise

instructions.preparation: standing behind machine hold on to support for balance. place foot under padded lever with heel on pedal.
instructions.execution: lift forefoot upward as far as possible. return by extending foot until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Lever (plate loaded).comments: Avoid pushing pedal down with heel as lever is lifted. Insure full range of motion is practiced. In starting lower position, lean back slightly until full planter flexion is felt. Establish range of motion criteria for highest position. Also see close up view. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Donkey Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position lower back and hips under upper lever pad. place forearms on supports. position heels on forward edge of platform.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot up and toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Often bending significantly at hips as shown in Sled Reverse Donkey Calf Raise typically reduces range of motion at ankle during dorsal flexion. Position torso more upright as shown, effectively reduces bend at hip. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Reverse Calf Extension

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and position heels on lever platform with fore feet extended off top. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Care must be taken to avoid heels from slipping off platform. Begin with very light weight to insure shoes have adequate traction. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place shoulders under padded lever. stand erect by extending hips and knees. position heels on forward edge of platform placed under padded lever. grasp handles or sides of padded lever.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Lever (selectorized).name: Seated Reverse Calf Press

instructions.preparation: place seat away from platform. sit on seat with lower back against padding and place feet very high on platform. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Lever (selectorized).comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still contact platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also see on alternative machine. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: 45Â° Reverse Calf Press

instructions.preparation: sit on seat with back on padded support. place feet very high on platform, grasp handles to sides, and extend knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Sled.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: 45Â° Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: sit on machine with lower back against padding. grasp handles to sides and place feet on platform. straighten knees and position heels on top edge of platform.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up and back toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. repeat.

Sled.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Also known as Sled Donkey Reverse Calf Raise. Also see movement performed on Sled Hack Press. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Donkey Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position lower back and hips under upper pad. place forearms on supports. position heels on forward edge of platform.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot up and toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. repeat.

Sled.comments: Often bending at the hip typically reduces range of motion at ankle during dorsal flexion. Two remedies include: (1) end knees slightly, (2) position torso more upright supported by extended arms, effectively reducing bend at hip as shown with Lever Reverse Donkey Calf Raise. In this last case, Triceps Brachii would act as stabilizer. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Hack Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: lie supine on back pad with shoulders against pads. place feet very high on platform. extend hips and knees. release dock levers.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed away from body. repeat.

Sled.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. Dock levers may not need to be released depending on machine model and body height. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Lying Reverse Calf Press

instructions.preparation: position sled away from platform. lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet very high on platform. grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Sled.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight. Keep knees straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Standing Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: place shoulders under padded bars. stand erect by extending hips and knees. position heels on forward edge of platform positioned under padded bars. grasp ends or sides of padded bars.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Sled.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Sled.name: Seated Reverse Calf Press

instructions.preparation: sit on seat and place feet very high on platform. grasp handles to sides and extend knees.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot back toward body as far as possible while pushing platform with heels. return feet down to platform and repeat.

Sled.comments: Feet may be moved up higher on platform if bottom of forefoot can still remain on platform with knees straight and back of hips can remain on back pad. The angle of back pad may be lowered back to keep back of hips on lower portion of back pad. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Smith.name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position bar upper chest height and place calf block under bar. position back of shoulders under bar and grasp bar to sides. position heels on forward edge of calf block. disengage bar by rotating bar back. stand erect with knees and hips straight.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Smith.comments: Throughout exercise, keep knees and hips straight. The exercise can be made more difficult by positioning heels closer to edge of platform. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Body Weight.name: Reverse Calf Raise

instructions.preparation: position heels on forward edge of calf block or platform. grasp support with other hand for balance.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot of both feet up toward body as far as possible. return by extending feet until toes are pointed downward. repeat.

Body Weight.comments: Keep knees and hips straight throughout exercise. See Dorsal Flexor Calf Exercise Analyses.

Stretch.name: Kneeling

instructions.preparation: kneel on both knees with buttocks over both heels and feet extend back.
instructions.execution: sit down on or toward heels. hold stretch.

Stretch.comments: Do not allow feet to wing out and do not sit between ankles. Certain knee problems maybe aggravated by this stretch.

Stretch.name: Lying

instructions.preparation: lie on one side. grasp top forefoot behind.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot to lower back. hold stretch. repeat with opposite foot.

Stretch.comments: See Lying (side) Quadriceps Stretch for similar exercise which can be combined with this stretch and performed simultaneously.

Stretch.name: Seated

instructions.preparation: sit on chair or bench and cross lower leg over thigh of opposite leg. place one hand above ankle and other hand on top of your foot.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot to extend ankle. hold stretch. repeat with opposite side.

Stretch.comments: None.

Stretch.name: Standing

instructions.preparation: stand and touch wall or stationary object for balance. grasp forefoot behind.
instructions.execution: pull forefoot to lower back. hold stretch. repeat with opposite side.

Stretch.comments: See Standing Quadriceps Stretch for similar exercise which can be combined with this stretch and performed simultaneously.
